intro: Camissonia hirtella, commonly known as the hairy camissonia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. This herbaceous perennial is characterized by its hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. Camissonia hirtella thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and inland valleys.
